alert.note: Alert for Montgomery (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 25 at 7:46PM CST until January 28 at 7:00AM CST by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed to Major severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Texas... West Fork San Jacinto near Conroe affecting Montgomery County. ...Forecast flooding changed from Moderate to Major severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Texas... Navidad River at Strane Park affecting Jackson County. For the West Fork San Jacinto River...including Porter, Sendera Ranch Road, Conroe, Humble, Sheldon...Major flooding is forecast. For the Navidad River...including Sublime, Speaks, Morales, Strane Park...Major flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Major flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...West Fork San Jacinto near Conroe. * WHEN...Until Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 117.8 feet, Major lowland flooding begins. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:15 PM CST Thursday the stage was 118.6 feet. - Bankfull stage is 113.8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:15 PM CST Thursday was 118.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 118.7 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage Saturday evening. - Flood stage is 115.8 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 118.5 feet on 04/18/1979. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (8 pm CST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun West Fork San Jacinto Conroe 115.8 118.6 Thu 7 pm CST 116.9 115.7 115.2 &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Friday afternoon at 200 PM CST.
